summary: Library that helps to check function and command arguments.
name: vimargumentchec
description:
This plugin provides the ability to check whether function or command
arguments match specific model or whether some value matches specific model.

Features:
    ∙ Checks a list of arguments against specified model
    ∙ Checks a single value against specified model
    ∙ Provides a way to specify default values for optional arguments
    ∙ Provides a way to check a single value, convert it, and check again
install_details:
You can install this plugin using scriptmanager (vimscript #2905) plugin (install scriptmanager, call scriptmanager#Install(["vimargumentchec"]) and add ``call scriptmanager#Activate(["vimargumentchec"])'' to your .vimrc, then reload vim. Vim-addon-manager will install all dependencies for you). You can also use archives attached to this page, they contain plugin with all dependencies, so you do not need to fetch them yourself. Note that vimscript #3186's and this plugin's archives contain the same files.

Gentoo users can use the following mercurial overlay: http://vimpluginloader.hg.sourceforge.net:8000/hgroot/vimpluginloader/pluginloader-overlay.

versions.release_notes: Added isdirectory and executable checks to file check
Removed redirection of error messages (that caused some bugs)
